scripts.comment: A couple examples using the block are shown below!

The Caesar cipher is a type of substitution cipher in which each letter of the alphabet is shifted by a fixed number of positions. In this example, we will shift the values on the ASCII table rather than the alphabet so we can represent a larger set of characters. Edit the custom block on the left to view the problem!

event.arg: <comment collabId="item_100" x="104.66666666666667" y="189.88888888888889" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>
<comment collabId="item_101" x="246" y="52.55555555555554" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>
<comment collabId="item_102" x="417.3333333333333" y="191.2222222222222" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>
Edit the custom block on the left to view the problem!
